item.value: A shark can hear a fish in the water from more than a mile away.
Steve Wozniak designed the first Apple computer in 1976. It was known as the Apple I.
John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
The original Olympic Games were a series of athletic competitions held in Ancient Greece.
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion). China has the most people, its population is 1.3 billion.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
The blue whale can produce sounds up to 188 decibels. This is the loudest sound produced by a living animal and has been detected as far away as 530 miles.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is only 4.6 billion years old.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. It can run at 112 kilometres per hour (70 mph). The average person can run from 12 - 17 miles an hour in sprints, so keep away from cheetahs.
Mount McKinley in Alaska in the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high.
The Sun is one of about 200 billion stars in the Milky Way galaxy. The most current estimates guess that there are 100 to 200 billion galaxies in the Universe
The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
The Chinese invented eyeglasses. Marco Polo reported seeing many pairs worn by the Chinese as early as 1275, 500 years before lens griding became an art in the West.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
Alaska is the largest state in America.
On July 20, 1969, Neil Armstrong became the first human to step on the moon. He, Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin and Michael Collins were the crew of Apollo 11.
